Text.Value: Should it come to that, I will not hesitate. But I think a different destiny awaits us.
That orb can deliver us victory - but a sort that we would not live to enjoy. Let us at least see how we fare, and if all else fails... the option remains.
The pride of Baldur's Gate.
Are you well, Gale? This would be a bad spot to fall into a faint.

EditorData.NodeContext: Side-eyed concern - personal worry, but also pragmatism that this is the worst possible moment for Gale to fall ill. We are standing atop the Netherbrain, floating high above the city

Text.Value: Gesture to the fact that you are now a mind flayer. Gale's self-sacrifice is not necessary.
You'd be dying in vain. I don't need company to sacrifice myself.
You know there's always another way.
No. Let me do this on my terms. Besides - I need someone left to sing my praises, after I'm gone.
I'm too long in the tooth to play sacrificial lamb - sacrificial bearded goat, more like. I will not just give in to the orb. Not when I've made it this far.
If I live at all, it will be no thanks to her. She didn't even deign to speak to me herself. Let her burn with fury - I choose to live.

EditorData.NodeContext: Determined

Text.Value: Damned stubborn fool. We can stop this thing. You don't have to -

EditorData.NodeContext: Interrupted when Gale casts a spell on Wyll.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Gale steps towards the stalk, grimly determined expression

Text.Value: Say nothing.
Say nothing.
Your fears are misplaced - the Crown will lead to a better world for all. I cannot ignore that.
The moment our victory is not assured, do not hesitate. Destroy the brain, whatever the cost - even if it is our lives.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined, but with a heavy undertone of grief. She's ready to die if it's necessary, but she REALLY wants to live - and is thinking of her unborn child's life as well.

Text.Value: The avenging exile.
And so do they.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [CHOICES] human-sized growth-pods emerge from the netherbrain's surface. They split apart and the Daisy forms of the present party members step out, ready for combat.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Daisys advance to flank the Emperor.
EditorData.NodeContext: with pure malice

Text.Value: To die destroying a great and grotesque brain - I think this might well be my destiny.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pure, breathless wonder - he's excited for the battle to come, and not at all put off by the prospect of certain death

Text.Value: Please... this will be so much easier knowing that my memory lives on with you.
I'm on borrowed time anyway. But don't pull the pin until you have to, hey? We might still win the old fashioned way.
Are you afraid, wizard? There is no shame in it when faced with madness such as this.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and reassuring - gentler than her usual self, as she encourages an ally to show courage right before the final battle with the netherbrain

Text.Value: Then we'd best win, wizard. If we cannot... well, this is quite the view.

EditorData.NodeContext: Having just been warned that Gale might need to self-destruct if we're losing the battle - which would kill us all

Text.Value: If we are to try the stones once more - we ought to do it there.

EditorData.NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

Text.Value: No... I would not presume that. I know quality when I see it.
Can't you feel it? We're almost there.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sense of awe/anticipation

Text.Value: What I want is a life I could share with you, but alas... knowing you're still out there will suffice for now.
If this is truly what you want...
Still, you will be taking unnecessary risks by proceeding. This could all be over in mere moments, if I ascend alone.
Gale? What's wrong?
Gale? What's wrong?
And what if your nerve fails at the last, wizard? I would rather trust my courage than yours.

EditorData.NodeContext: intense moment - the final battle is unfolding, and Gale just offered to sacrifice himself. Minthara is not convinced

Text.Value: Sometimes I wish I were a more selfish man. Life would be so much easier. But alas...
What the hells are those things?!
And you will make spectacular thralls.
Forget it, Gale. You don't have to do this.
The pride of Baldur's Gate.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (GALE COMPANION READY FOR DEATH (NO ONE TRANFORMED YET))

Text.Value: You were always a stubborn one, Gale. Well - if this is to be your end, then you have made the most of it.
Should circumstances become that dire, I will not hesitate. But I dearly hope that will not be necessary.
Nature's servant.
The fury of Avernus.
You're distracted. Speak, or let your thoughts haunt you.
Don't be ridiculous, Gale. This isn't necessary.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [CHOICES][Player] grab onto the tentacle, pulses of mocking noise burst through your mind. You push through, take a firm grip and make your ascent.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: |You grab onto the tentacle, pulses of mocking noise burst through your mind. You push through, take a firm grip and make your ascent.|

Text.Value: This isn't giving up it's securing victory, at a price I am willing to pay. And everything we shared can live on - with you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A spiral of blue magic rises from the ground, enveloping the player. It grows in intensity, into a vortex. Player's POV: one last glimpse of Gale smiling sadly, before the blue magic swallows his image...

Text.Value: Say nothing. You have already transformed yourself in order to stop the Absolute. That should remain the plan.
Always another way, yes - but not necessarily a better way.
You're right. We're getting you that crown.
I'm ready. Are you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Determined

Text.Value: There's endless wonder out there. Infinite possibilities. Perhaps fate will bring us back together, before the universe dims.
Just reminding myself of our plan - we attack the brain, then comes Orpheus' part.
That is our target. Focus the power of the netherstones on the crown, and we may yet triumph!

EditorData.NodeContext: the final battle against the netherbrain is underway - the struggle is desperate, but Minthara rallies herself and her allies with a final command

Text.Value: The hatchling who rejected her queen.
Is there no end to these horrors?

EditorData.NodeContext: witnessing the creation of horrifying fleshy monsters during the final fight with the netherbrain - aghast, and slightly in awe

Text.Value: Just reminding myself of our plan - we attack the brain, then comes the Emperor's part.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [CHOICES] four (or equivalent number to party) fleshy growth-pods emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly, four (or equivalent number to party) fleshy growth-pods emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them.

Text.Value: What in the Hells are those?
As viable a plan as any while staring into the maw of perdition. Shall we?
You presume I wouldn't stand by your side, right to the end.
I'm not going anywhere. We stay together, right to the end.
Are you quite sure you wish to place all your trust there? This would all be over in mere moments, if I ascend alone.
I'm sure such an outcome is possible, but why risk it? If we ascend there, and try to fight the good fight... well, there're no guarantees.
No, I want to stay by your side.
I understand, but I had to mention it while there was time. Let's carry on and end this.
Shit. That can't be good.
If there is even the slimmest chance of success once we ascend, I wish to pursue it.
I thought I made my feelings plain - I do not want to take that step. Not anymore.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [CHOICES][Gale] casts a teleportation spell on his companions. A spiral of blue magic rises from the ground, enveloping them It grows in intensity, into a vortex. When it fades, they are gone. Gale turns to ascend the stalk.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Gale casts a teleportation spell on his companions. A spiral of blue magic rises from the ground, enveloping them It grows in intensity, into a vortex. When it fades, they are gone. Gale turns to ascend the stalk.

Text.Value: Orpheus has already transformed into a mind flayer.
I could simply tell you what you want to hear, then ascend by myself and seize the Crown anyway, you know.
Your orb - the fight we're facing could be over before it even begins... if you're willing to make the sacrifice.
What I want? Perhaps not... But what I need? I believe so. But it may not be the last turn of the page, even if it seems so.
What about all we shared together? Are you just going to give up?
The false daughter of darkness. Shunned by her goddess.
Fresh horrors. They will fall, like all the others.
The hamster that voyaged through wildspace.
*A thought occurs to you as you gaze at the monstrosity above. Gale's orb remains an option - one that could put an end to the Absolute, once and for all.*
If we must butcher our dreams, so be it.
No, Gale. We're going to end this together - and live to tell the tale.
Too foolish for me to allow, pup. So why do I feel like you aren't asking? Ah.

EditorData.NodeContext: Looking at threat ahead, then back to Gale. He's making a heroic sacrifice - the 'Ah' is after a beat as she recognises what he's about to do  - cast a spell to send her away.

Text.Value: The puppet of the githyanki queen.
So be it. But if the tide of battle turns against us, be ready to end this.
The avenging exile.
There it is - the Crown.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up and sees the Crown of Kharsus.

Text.Value: There's no sense dwelling on such a future is locked behind the looming shadow of the Netherbrain. First, we must fight. Then we deal with the Crown.

EditorData.NodeContext: Determined

Text.Value: The world is counting on us, and the nether brain is too powerful. The orb is the only guarantee of victory we have.
You urged me to this point, and now you falter? What would you have me do, sacrifice myself and hope that Mystra eulogises my ashes?
The fury of Avernus.
You are a spectacular specimen.
We did, but look at the devastation around us. You need to end this now.
My gods! I didn't think they were real. Not really.
My gods! I didn't think they were real. Not really.
See you on the other side, Gale. It's been an honour.
See you on the other side, Gale. It's been an honour.
Move forward. Perhaps you will find a way to stop the brain, without resorting to the orb.
Move forward. Perhaps you will find a way to stop the brain, without resorting to the orb.
No. But surely you see now how dangerous the crown is? We must make sure it's destroyed.
*The place where the Netherstones can enforce control.*
The false daughter of darkness. Shunned by her goddess.
Perish the thought. I have no intention of failing, and neither should you.
The puppet of the githyanki queen.
That's where we should use the Netherstones.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Emperor lands in battle on a dragon. 
Party reacts with horror. 
Emperor makes a gesture with his hand to summon the super-Daisies

Text.Value: Looks like that Crown could use some Netherstones. If these things were ever going to work, it's now.
Looks like that Crown could use some Netherstones. If these things were ever going to work, it's now.
We need to use the Netherstones on the Crown. That is our fated path.
The wizard who defied a goddess.
You're certain you won't reconsider?
What's the alternative? I allow the Absolute to have its way? Die in vain along with all its victims? Or flee, and live on in shame?
I must disagree. It is necessary - and the right thing to do. Every moment I hesitate is costing lives.
Something's wrong. Talk to me.
There you are.
Are you sure you want this crown? Look at the damage it's caused...
Murder incarnate.
...and the Grand Design will be stopped. An honourable contingency, Gale. And one I mean to avoid.
The brain... it's high above the city now - far away from any innocents.

EditorData.logicalname: GALE COMPANION READY FOR DEATH (NO ONE TRANFORMED YET)

Text.Value: As much as I enjoy your company, I'm not willing to kill you just to wring out a few last moments.
If the fight should turn against us, and we have no other option, then rest assured I shall unleash the orb. But I believe there is a much grander destiny in store for us.
Step forward - alone. Once up there, you must unleash the orb without hesitation, or all is lost.
Step forward - alone. Once up there, you must unleash the orb without hesitation, or all is lost.
You're certain, then. I won't try to force you to do otherwise. Let's keep going.
Nature's servant.
Alone, wizard? I thought you were of the clever kind. Boo and I are here, and here we -

EditorData.NodeContext: Refusing to let Gale go on alone - is cut off mid-sentence as Gale teleports them away

Text.Value: You intend to go up there by yourself? To die alone?
And I would die in the process, just to win the favour of a goddess who scarcely cares for me. We discussed this at length - I thought you and I were of a similar mind.
No. I can't give up... and I don't want this to be how I part from you. Let us at least try.
The daughter of darkness.
Wait. We could end this now if you unleashed the orb.
Then I think it's about time we ascended, don't you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Determined

Text.Value: You're plotting something, aren't you? Come on then - out with it. I'd rather know before we take on that cerebral monstrosity.

EditorData.NodeContext: An edge of concern - worried what you're about to bring up

Text.Value: That's... that's the person from my dreams...
The hamster that voyaged through wildspace.
The wizard who defied a goddess.
The ratcatcher that became a lord.
This is where we part ways. I'm sending you someplace safe, then I'm going to put a stop to this - alone.
This is where we part ways. I'm sending you someplace safe, then I'm going to put a stop to this - alone.
You are spectacular specimens.
The infamous figure from your dreams, I take it.
The world is counting on us, and the nether brain is too powerful. I can't bear the thought of losing you, but the orb is the only guarantee.
*There it is - the Crown of Karsus, the site of power, the site of domination.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up and sees the Crown of Kharsus.

Text.Value: There lies our answer. Use the Netherstones on the Crown, and we can bring an end to this.
For now, at least.
No, we can ascend together and put an end to this. Should it look like we'll fail... that's your moment.
Well that's just disgusting.
That face. The one from my dreams...
Gale? What's the matter?
Lead on, then. I shall stay my hand as long as I can - but if the tide of battle turns against us, remember I have the means to bring a swift end to this.
If you're mistaken, this could be the end of everything. We will be failing, right at the last hurdle.
I can feel it - the thing in your chest - it's ready to blow, isn't it? It's certainly a possible way out...
What are you waiting for?
What are you waiting for?
No harm in clinging to optimism a little longer. If events turn against us, at least we'll know you can act. The Absolute isn't winning, one way or another.
I'm glad. It would be more than a touch awkward if you tried and I had to turn on you.
The very thing that has been amplifying the Netherbrain's power, and the very place that we will be able to dominate it.
I know you won't. I trust you.
Your dream visitors, I take it? I thought they would be prettier.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unimpressed bravado - the Brain has just dramatically spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must fight

Text.Value: You've brought me right where I need to be - I have no right to ask more of you. It's time I spirited you to safety, for this is a fate I must face alone.

EditorData.NodeContext: readying himself for death, saying goodbye

Text.Value: Goodbye, Gale.
Fugamus inferni blandimenta.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale begins to cast a teleportation spell.
EditorData.NodeContext: Latin: foo-GA-moos in-FER-nee blan-dee-MEN-ta

Text.Value: I don't want to leave you.
Eh, Boo? Can this Netherbrain sprout Nether-lice?

EditorData.NodeContext: Note of vague bemusement - we've just watched the netherbrain graphically spawn a number of super-thralls that we must fight atop it.

Text.Value: But this way, we'll know the matter is done, and we'll know exactly what it shall cost - me, and me alone.
But it won't come to that, for I have the means to spirit away those I care about to a safe remove, before the final curtain.
You'd do that? Sacrifice yourself for us...? If this is truly what you want, then thank you.
That face... the one in my dreams...
What the fuck are those?!
What the fuck are those?!
True, but it's not too late to reconsider. This would all be over in mere moments, if I ascend alone.
And you will make an even better thrall.
I'm as ready as I'll ever be. Should the worst transpire, and we seem destined to fail... well, the orb remains an option. But I truly hope it does not come to that.
I can end this now - stop the Absolute, and spare the city. The stage is set for my final act. Mystra's bidding. And the redemption that lies beyond.
The Netherstones - perhaps if we use them here, they'll work this time.
The Netherstones might prove more effective if we use them now.
The dream invaders - but these ones have real skulls for the splitting.

EditorData.NodeContext: Violent relish -  the Brain has just spawned identical copies of the player's dream figure that we must figh

Text.Value: Mystra will never forgive you for refusing her command. Can you live with that?
Are you sure about this? There must be another way - one that lets you live.
Once we ascend the Netherbrain's stem, we'll be in touching distance of the crown. Of reclaiming the powers of Karsus himself.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sense of awe/anticipation

Text.Value: I know you - I saw you in my dreams.
If it seems like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me.
If it seems like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me.
That's it! We have to use the Netherstones on the Crown - it's the only hope we have.
But... I only made it this far thanks to you. Who am I to question such sterling guidance now?
You make it sound like such a small thing. No - I do not wish to die.
The figure from my dreams...
Guardian of groves.
Tsk'va! One abomination births another!
Besides - such a sacrifice won't be necessary if I claim the Crown of Karsus.
Oh, because it wasn't quite crowded enough up here already.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dry sarcasm - we're atop the Netherbrain floating above the city, and it has just graphically spawned a number of super-thralls for us to fight

Text.Value: So be it - lead on.
Mystra won't be pleased... but perhaps trying to please the gods is a fool's errand.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wry. 'This will land me in hot water, you know'

Text.Value: Well I care for that even less. Let's make sure we prevail, then.

EditorData.NodeContext: Response to "If it seem like we won't prevail up there, I'll be forced to use the orb - and you'll die with me."

Text.Value: I thought I meant more to you than a sacrificial lamb. Clearly I was mistaken. I will not cast everything away, not when I know what's out there, almost within my grasp.

EditorData.NodeContext: Disappointed you've tried so hard to convince him

Text.Value: I... I don't know what to say. Thank you.
If you're wrong, we'll have squandered the chance for a better world. You understand that, don't you?
I won't stand in your way, then. Farewell, Gale.
Then this is farewell...
Guardian of groves.
Mystra will never forgive you if you allow the crown to slip from your grasp. The orb guarantees redemption.
Gale? You have a look. I'm not sure I care for it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale looks somber and fatalistic

Text.Value: We have the Emperor's support - your sacrifice isn't necessary.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Four fleshy growth-pods  emerge from the Netherbrain and the super-thralls are birthed from within them. A red dragon lands. The thralls and dragon prepare for combat.

Text.Value: You could, but you won't. You know the stakes are too high to give in to your own ambitions.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [CHOICES] a bunch of fleshy growth-pods emerge from the Netherbrain and a bunch of daisies are birthed from within them.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly, a bunch of human-sized growth-pods emerge from the netherbrain's surface. They split apart and the Daisy forms of the present party members step out, ready for combat.

Text.Value: But... perhaps saving the day will suffice for now. A better world can always follow, so long as we survive.
It's now, or never.
The ratcatcher that became a lord.
It's nothing - just gathering myself. Let's proceed.
There - let us try the stones on the tyrant's tiara!

EditorData.NodeContext: Looking up at the Crown of Karsus on top of the Netherbrain

Text.Value: You do not look well, wizard. Beyond even your daily feebleness.

EditorData.NodeContext: Brute concern, in his own way. Gale is looking up at the Netherbrain, his chest orb preparing to explode

Text.Value: You would step forth, alone, to save the world at the expense of your own life. There would be no greater sacrifice.
You're right. The orb is the only way. All that's left for me to do is spirit you away to safety. Are you ready?
It's just a choice between two deaths. Quick and meaningful, or torturous and pointless.
I could simply tell you what you want to hear, then ascend by myself and take on the brain alone, you know.

EditorData.NodeContext: With a sigh - he knows he won't do this.

Text.Value: You must use the orb, Gale. Your sacrifice will save everything.
Please. For too long I've lived in fear of taking a host of innocents with me when I expired. Now at least I can be assured my demise will be saving them instead.
The orb stirs because it knows the Crown of Karsus is close. It waits for you to claim it. All you have to do is ascend.
The orb stirs because it knows the Crown of Karsus is close. It waits for you to claim it. All you have to do is ascend.
You don't have to do this, Gale. We can bring the Crown to Mystra.
Keep it in mind at least, should the tide of battle turn against us.
The daughter of darkness.
*Perhaps united, you can stop the brain without having to resort to the orb... but should you risk failure, the final, irreversible solution remains within your power.*
I know you. I know everything about you. Your thoughts, your feelings, your weaknesses.

EditorData.NodeContext: Emperor is against the player now, and enthralled to the Netherbrain

Text.Value: The Netherstones may yet work - this time.
The hatchling who rejected her queen.
Are you certain you know what you're going to do with it?
That said, should the worst transpire, and we seem destined to fail... well, the orb remains an option. But I truly hope it does not come to that.
I'm ready. Let's get you that crown.
*As you gaze upwards at the monstrosity above you, the orb in your chest seems to pulse, like a dark second heart.*
Gale - what's troubling you? We're nearly at the end, I know it

Synopsis:
Introduction to the last fight of the game against the Netherbrain. This dialog plays once the players enter the last combat arena, after the upper high hall escalade.

Player climbs to the top of the Netherbrain. We see the Crown of Kharsus and realise that's where we need to cast the spell to dominate the brain. If the Emperor is against us, it appears, enthralled to the brain, and raises an army of daisies. If the Emperor is with us, the Netherbrain raises a bunch of super-thralls trained on our exact weaknesses.
